cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 110 mi W of the Dry Tortugas
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest across the eastern Gulf of Mexico and expected to turn north toward the Florida Panhandle / Alabama coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: northern Gulf Coast near the western Florida Panhandle or extreme southeast Alabama coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Alabama/Florida border eastward to Ochlockonee River, FL (northern Gulf Coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys, Florida Big Bend and Panhandle, Alabama Gulf Coast
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusty showers; sustained tropical-storm-force winds are not expected at the port (probability ≤4%).
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Atlantic side where Port Everglades is located.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches possible with locally higher amounts, producing brief urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and swells propagating around the Keys may reach the southeast Florida coast; very low tornado risk.
